autograd.torch.tensor module

class autograd.torch.tensor.Node(grad_fn, next_functions, name='')

Bases: object

class autograd.torch.tensor.Tensor(data, name='', requires_grad=False)

Bases: object

property T

Return the transpose of the Tensor.

Returns:

The transposed Tensor object.

accum_grad(grad)

Gradient accumulation function.

backward(gradient=None, retain_graph=False)

Perform backpropagation to compute gradients for all Node objects involved in the computation graph and store the gradients in the leaf Tensor nodes requiring gradient computation.

This method traverses the computation graph, starting from the Node object associated with the current Tensor object and propagating gradients to the previous Node objects using their respective gradient functions.

Args:

gradient: Gradient w.r.t. the tensor. retain: If True, the graph used to compute the grads will be retained, otherwise it will be freed (default: False).

Returns:

None

static broadcast_axis(shape_left, shape_right)

Determine the axes along which broadcasting occurs between two shapes.

Args:

shape_left: Shape of the left tensor. shape_right: Shape of the right tensor.

Returns:

A tuple of two tuples representing the axes along which broadcasting occurs.

exp()

Compute the exponential of each element in the Tensor.

Returns:

The resulting Tensor object representing the exponential.

grad_enabled = True
log()

Compute the natural logarithm of each element in the Tensor.

Returns:

The resulting Tensor object representing the logarithm.

log_softmax(dim=-1)

Applies a softmax function followed by a logarithm.

Args:

dim: The dimension along which to compute the log-softmax (default: -1).

Returns:

The resulting Tensor object after applying the log-softmax function.

relu()

Apply the Rectified Linear Unit (ReLU) activation function element-wise.

Returns:

The resulting Tensor object after applying ReLU.

sigmoid()

Apply the sigmoid activation function element-wise.

Returns:

The resulting Tensor object after applying the sigmoid function.

sum(dim=None, keepdim=False)

Compute the sum of elements in the Tensor.

Args:

dim: The dimension or dimensions to reduce. If None, all dimensions are reduced (optional). keepdim: If True the axes which are reduced are left in the result as dimensions with size 1 (default: False).

Returns:

The resulting Tensor object representing the sum.

tanh()

Apply the hyperbolic tangent (tanh) activation function element-wise.

Returns:

The resulting Tensor object after applying the tanh function.
